vision: An AI-powered Business Operating System that transforms productivity through intelligent automation, strategic alignment, and frictionless execution

target_audience.primary: Solo e-commerce brand owners and small business operators seeking AI-powered productivity systems
secondary: Content creators managing multiple output channels
Entrepreneurs overwhelmed by project management tools
Business owners wanting to leverage AI without coding

phases.name: Foundation
phases.description: Core infrastructure improvements and quick wins that address critical competitor pain points while enhancing the existing MVP with automation capabilities

milestones.title: CLI Automation Enabled
milestones.description: Users can trigger daily planning, assessments, and agent actions via simple CLI commands instead of manual prompts

milestones.title: Context System Operational
milestones.description: AI sessions automatically load and preserve context, eliminating the #1 competitor pain point

milestones.title: Daily Flow Streamlined
milestones.description: Morning planning completes in under 60 seconds with enhanced productivity scoring

phases.name: Enhancement
phases.description: User experience improvements and productivity features that deepen strategic alignment and provide objective measurement capabilities

milestones.title: Strategic Alignment Dashboard
milestones.description: Users can visualize how daily work connects to OBG and track strategic progress over time

milestones.title: Intelligent Agent Coordination
milestones.description: AI agents can communicate and hand off work automatically without manual file coordination

milestones.title: Pattern Recognition System
milestones.description: System identifies productivity patterns and proactively suggests optimizations

phases.name: Scale
phases.description: External integrations, advanced automation, and performance optimizations that extend the system's reach

milestones.title: Calendar and Time Integration
milestones.description: System syncs with external calendar and optionally tracks time spent on tasks

milestones.title: Cross-Device Sync
milestones.description: Work context available across multiple devices via Git-based sync

phases.name: Future Vision
phases.description: Long-term capabilities that expand accessibility and market reach while maintaining the core conversational interface

milestones.title: Web Accessibility
milestones.description: Users can access the system via web interface in addition to terminal

milestones.title: Agent Ecosystem
milestones.description: Marketplace for sharing and discovering specialized AI agents

features.title: CLI Command System
features.description: Implement shortcut CLI commands (e.g., /morning, /evening, /focus) that trigger common workflows without requiring users to type full prompts. Each command maps to predefined agent interactions.
features.rationale: Users currently must manually type or paste prompts to trigger workflows. CLI commands reduce friction and make the system feel more like a native tool. Addresses the complexity complaints from Obsidian (pain-2-1, pain-2-2) where users want things to 'just work' without extensive setup.
acceptance_criteria: /morning command generates daily roadmap in under 60 seconds
/evening command triggers productivity assessment
/focus command identifies THE ONE THING for the day
Commands can accept optional parameters (e.g., /morning --brief)
Help text available via /help command
user_stories: As a busy entrepreneur, I want to type '/morning' to instantly get my daily plan so that I don't waste time on prompt engineering
As a user, I want shortcuts for common actions so that the system feels as fast as native CLI tools

features.title: Centralized Agent Registry
features.description: Create a unified registry that catalogs all AI agents with their capabilities, prompts, input/output specifications, and invocation methods. Enables discoverability and consistent agent management.
features.rationale: Currently agent prompts are scattered across multiple markdown files making it hard to understand what agents exist and how to use them. A centralized registry addresses the technical debt and mirrors how Obsidian users struggle with plugin management (pain-2-2, pain-2-6).
acceptance_criteria: Single JSON/YAML file contains all agent definitions
Each agent has documented inputs, outputs, and trigger methods
Agents can be listed via /agents command
Agent prompts are validated for required fields
Documentation auto-generated from registry
user_stories: As a user, I want to see all available agents in one place so that I know what capabilities the system has
As a developer, I want agent definitions standardized so that I can easily add or modify agents

features.title: Automatic Session Context Loading
features.description: Implement automatic loading of relevant context at the start of each session including recent work, active projects, current OBG, and pending tasks. No manual context restoration required.
features.rationale: This is THE #1 differentiator vs ChatGPT/Claude workflows (pain-6-1, gap-1). Every competitor AI tool requires users to re-explain their situation each session. Automatic context loading transforms the user experience from 'starting over' to 'continuing where you left off'.
acceptance_criteria: Session starts with summary of last session's work within 5 seconds
Active projects and their status automatically available to AI
OBG and current tier priorities loaded without user action
Context includes last 7 days of productivity scores
Users can override with '/fresh' to start clean session
user_stories: As a user, I want the AI to remember what I worked on yesterday so that I don't waste time re-explaining context
As an entrepreneur, I want my strategic goals always present so that every conversation stays aligned with my OBG

features.title: Smart Work Tracking
features.description: Automatically track and log work completed during each session including tasks done, files modified, decisions made, and time spent. Creates an objective record without manual entry.
features.rationale: Addresses the 'no objective measurement' gap (gap-4) and eliminates manual tracking that plagues tools like Notion (pain-1-3). Users get accurate records of their work without maintenance burden.
acceptance_criteria: Tasks completed during session automatically logged
Work log accessible via /history command
Daily summary generated at end of each session
Integration with productivity scoring system
No manual data entry required from user
user_stories: As a user, I want my work automatically tracked so that I have an accurate record without manual logging
As a business owner, I want to see exactly what was accomplished each day for accountability

features.title: Enhanced Productivity Scoring
features.description: Upgrade the productivity scoring system to provide more detailed, actionable feedback including category breakdowns, trend analysis, and specific improvement recommendations based on patterns.
features.rationale: Current 1-10 scoring is good but could be more insightful. Addresses gap-4 (objective measurement) and differentiates from all competitors who lack any productivity measurement. Leverages pattern recognition from 20 years of productivity principles.
acceptance_criteria: Score breakdown by category (focus, completion, alignment)
Week-over-week trend comparison
Specific improvement suggestions based on patterns
Celebration of achievements and streaks
Score history accessible via /scores command
user_stories: As a user, I want to understand WHY I got a certain productivity score so that I can improve
As an entrepreneur, I want to see my productivity trends so that I can identify patterns

features.title: Intelligent Kill List Management
features.description: Automated management of things NOT to do, including smart reminders when users attempt forbidden activities, pattern detection for recurring temptations, and integration with daily planning.
features.rationale: Unique differentiator (gap-8) - no competitor actively tracks what NOT to do. Kill lists are a powerful productivity principle that prevents wasted time on low-value activities. Makes the system proactively protective of user focus.
acceptance_criteria: Kill list items visible during morning planning
AI warns when user mentions kill list activities
Weekly summary of kill list violations vs adherence
Easy add/remove items via /kill command
Categories for different types of kills (distractions, projects, habits)
user_stories: As a user prone to distractions, I want the AI to remind me of things I said NOT to do so that I stay focused
As an entrepreneur, I want to track projects I've killed so I don't accidentally resurrect them

features.title: OBG Alignment Dashboard
features.description: Visual representation showing how current work connects to the One Big Obsessional Goal. Includes alignment scores for each project, strategic drift warnings, and progress tracking toward OBG milestones.
features.rationale: Addresses gap-3 (connecting daily to strategic) which affects almost every competitor. Makes strategic alignment visible and measurable rather than assumed. Prevents the strategic drift that is a major user pain point.
acceptance_criteria: Visual display of OBG with current progress percentage
Each active project shows alignment score to OBG
Warning when daily tasks don't connect to OBG
Weekly OBG progress report with trend line
Accessible via /obg or /alignment command
user_stories: As an entrepreneur, I want to see how my daily work connects to my big goal so that I don't lose sight of what matters
As a user, I want warnings when I'm drifting from my strategy so that I can course correct

features.title: Productivity Analytics Dashboard
features.description: Comprehensive analytics view showing productivity trends, time allocation, task completion rates, and pattern insights over configurable time periods (week, month, quarter).
features.rationale: Addresses the known gap for limited analytics while providing the objective measurement that competitors lack (gap-4). Helps users understand their productivity patterns for continuous improvement.
acceptance_criteria: Weekly productivity summary auto-generated
Monthly pattern analysis with recommendations
Tier 1/2/3 task completion ratios tracked
Focus time vs context-switching metrics
Accessible via /analytics command
user_stories: As a user, I want to see my productivity trends over time so that I can understand what affects my performance
As a business owner, I want monthly analytics so that I can make informed decisions about my work habits

features.title: Agent Communication Protocol
features.description: Standardized protocol for AI agents to communicate and coordinate without manual file-based coordination. Agents can pass context, request assistance, and share results through defined interfaces.
features.rationale: Addresses technical debt of manual agent coordination. As the system grows with more specialized agents, inter-agent communication becomes critical. Prevents the disjointed experience users complain about with Obsidian plugins (pain-2-6).
acceptance_criteria: Agents can invoke other agents with defined inputs
Context passes automatically between agent handoffs
Agent chains can be defined for complex workflows
Errors in agent chains handled gracefully
Communication logs available for debugging
user_stories: As a user, I want agents to work together seamlessly so that complex tasks feel like one interaction
As a developer, I want standardized agent communication so that adding new agents is straightforward

features.title: Smart Delegation to Agent Teams
features.description: Enable fire-and-forget delegation where users describe a task and the system automatically routes it to the appropriate agent(s), manages the workflow, and reports back results.
features.rationale: This is the 'leverage' promise of AI - delegation without micromanagement. Addresses the desire for 3-5x execution speed improvement. Makes the department-based agent organization actually feel like having a business team.
acceptance_criteria: Users can describe task in natural language
System identifies appropriate agent(s) for task
Progress updates provided during execution
Results summarized and presented to user
User can intervene or redirect if needed
user_stories: As a busy entrepreneur, I want to describe what I need and have the right AI agent handle it so that I can focus on high-level decisions
As a content creator, I want to delegate content tasks and receive finished work so that I save hours per week

features.title: Proactive Pattern Recognition
features.description: AI proactively identifies patterns in user behavior, productivity, and work habits. Provides unsolicited but helpful suggestions for optimization based on detected patterns.
features.rationale: Differentiates from reactive tools by being proactively helpful. Uses the 20 years of productivity principles to provide contextually relevant advice. Addresses pain-6-2 where AI quality feels inconsistent - structured pattern recognition provides consistent value.
acceptance_criteria: System identifies recurring productivity patterns
Suggestions based on patterns appear in morning planning
Users can accept, dismiss, or snooze suggestions
Pattern library grows based on user feedback
Privacy-respecting local pattern analysis
user_stories: As a user, I want the AI to notice things I don't see about my work patterns so that I can improve
As an entrepreneur, I want proactive optimization suggestions so that I'm always getting better

features.title: Calendar Integration
features.description: Two-way integration with external calendar systems (Google Calendar, Apple Calendar) to incorporate scheduled events into daily planning and optionally block time for focused work.
features.rationale: Addresses the known gap of no external integrations. Calendar awareness makes daily planning more realistic and prevents conflicts. Addresses pain-5-3 where Todoist users want calendar + tasks together.
acceptance_criteria: Today's calendar events visible in morning planning
Time blocks suggested around fixed appointments
Focus time can be added to calendar from system
Supports Google Calendar and Apple Calendar
Read-only mode available for security-conscious users
user_stories: As a user with meetings, I want my calendar events in my daily plan so that I can schedule work around them
As an entrepreneur, I want to block focus time on my calendar so that others respect my work time

features.title: Optional Time Tracking
features.description: Lightweight time tracking that records how long tasks take without requiring manual start/stop. Uses session timestamps and work logs to estimate time allocation.
features.rationale: Addresses the known gap for automated time tracking while being non-intrusive. Competitors like Monday.com lock time tracking behind expensive tiers (pain-4-4). Makes time visible without adding friction.
acceptance_criteria: Session duration automatically tracked
Time estimates for tasks based on historical data
Weekly time allocation report by project/category
No manual timers or tracking required
Data exportable for invoicing if needed
user_stories: As a freelancer, I want to know how long tasks actually take so that I can estimate better
As a user, I want to see where my time goes without manually tracking it

features.title: Git-Based Sync System
features.description: Robust cross-device synchronization using Git as the transport layer. Handles conflicts gracefully and ensures work context available on any device with the system installed.
features.rationale: Addresses the known gap of local filesystem limiting cross-device sync. Uses familiar Git infrastructure for reliability. Avoids Obsidian sync issues (pain-2-4) by using battle-tested version control.
acceptance_criteria: One-command sync to remote repository
Automatic conflict detection with resolution helpers
Sync status visible in system status
Works with GitHub, GitLab, or any Git remote
Offline changes queued until connectivity restored
user_stories: As a user with multiple computers, I want my work context synced so that I can continue from any device
As a user, I want version history of my work so that I can recover from mistakes

features.title: Template Library
features.description: Collection of pre-built templates for common business scenarios including product launches, content campaigns, project kickoffs, and strategic reviews. Reduces setup time and ensures best practices.
features.rationale: Addresses gap-2 where tools require significant setup before delivering value. Templates provide instant value and encode the productivity methodology. Differentiates from generic AI that has no domain knowledge.
acceptance_criteria: At least 10 templates for common scenarios
Templates accessible via /template command
Users can customize and save their own templates
Templates include relevant agent configurations
Templates versioned and updatable
user_stories: As a new user, I want templates that work immediately so that I don't have to figure out setup
As an e-commerce owner, I want product launch templates so that I follow proven processes

features.title: Web Interface
features.description: Optional web-based interface for users who prefer GUI over terminal. Maintains the conversational paradigm while providing visual elements for dashboards and status views.
features.rationale: Addresses the constraint of terminal-only access limiting accessibility. Opens the system to users uncomfortable with command line. However, this is a significant architectural change so it's future phase.
acceptance_criteria: Core functionality accessible via web browser
Conversational interface maintained in web UI
Dashboard visualizations for productivity data
Mobile-responsive design
Secure authentication for web access
user_stories: As a user who prefers GUI, I want a web interface so that I can use the system without terminal
As a mobile user, I want web access so that I can check my status on the go

features.title: Custom Agent Creator
features.description: User-friendly interface for creating custom AI agents without coding. Guides users through defining agent purpose, prompts, inputs/outputs, and integration with the system.
features.rationale: Extends the HR Department's GPT Express framework to be more accessible. Enables users to create specialized agents for their unique business needs. Similar to how Obsidian relies on plugins but with guided creation.
acceptance_criteria: Wizard-style interface for agent creation
Prompt templates for common agent types
Testing interface before publishing agent
Version control for custom agents
Agents registered automatically in system registry
user_stories: As a power user, I want to create my own agents so that I can automate unique aspects of my business
As a user with specific needs, I want custom agents without coding so that I can extend the system

features.title: Agent Marketplace
features.description: Platform for sharing and discovering AI agents created by the community. Includes ratings, reviews, and one-click installation of vetted agents.
features.rationale: Long-term vision for community growth and ecosystem building. Addresses the need for specialized functionality without requiring every user to build from scratch. Creates network effects for platform adoption.
acceptance_criteria: Searchable catalog of community agents
Rating and review system
One-click installation of agents
Verification/vetting process for security
Revenue sharing for agent creators
user_stories: As a user, I want to discover agents others have built so that I can benefit from community knowledge
As an agent creator, I want to share my agents so that others can benefit from my work
